instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

Working on 820 3476 with short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>! 

more precisely i have a short on pin 2 L7095. With my Power supply i put a wire with 1V on pin pin 2 for find the bad component and only heat <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR>! But the stupid think is i remove the <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR> and when i put 1v on L7095 the pin 1 off <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR> keeps burning. when i put ?lcool isoprop?lico on area off <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR> i can see the alcohol evaporate at the pin1 off <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR>. I don't have others components heating on this board!  

Already replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> for a new one and same history! 

How do I find this short?? 

Thanks

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Short inside the board.
Try eliminate it digging a bit down in the board.

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Ok, This one can be closed!! i tried to dig a bit but the short don't goes off!! The <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR> it's closed to processor.. the probably to fuck one rail it's high! 

thanks

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Board is already f**d, nothing to lose...
